title: Black Panther Masthead
content:
I am trying to identify what the condensed typeface is that was used for the masthead of 'The Black Panther' designed by Emory Douglas in 1971. It may or may not be obvious to some of you. Thanks in advance.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [v6n5-2-27-71.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/http:/typophile.com/files/v6n5-2-27-71.jpg) | 132.37 KB |
author: AlHarbron

comments.content:
1971 is near the apex of the photolettering era when fonts were commonly squeezed, stretched and otherwise distorted on demand.  
so the nameplate \_THE BLACK PANTHER\_ may be somewhat different from the font used to derive it.  
In no particular order, here are some fonts based on narrow linears of the era.  
Permanent Headline URW

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PermanentHeadlineURW-AsBLACKPANTHER_5780.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/permanent/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/permanent/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/permanent/")  
Plakette TS Light  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PlaketteTSLight-AsBLACKPANTHER_5068.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/plakette/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/plakette/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef-typeshop/plakette/")  
British Inserat MN Cond
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/BritishInseratMNCond-AsBLACKPANTHER_5343.gif)
  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/british-inserat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/british-inserat/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfmecanorma/british-inserat/")  
Don

Also Rama Gothic Cond Bold

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/RamaGothicCondBold-AsBLACKPANTHER_3828.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/rama-gothic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/rama-gothic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/flat-it/rama-gothic/")  
Don

DTD Silvertone Woodtype ExtraCond

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631im_/http:/typophile.com/files/DTDSilvertoneWoodtypeExtraCond-AsBLACKPANTHER_5306.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thometz/silvertone-woodtype/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thometz/silvertone-woodtype/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/thometz/silvertone-woodtype/")  
An interpretation of Ludlow 6-EC Gothic Extra Condensed woodtype.  
Don

Some of them are very close, 'Rama Gothic Cond Bold' looks the best fit I think, thanks so much Don, really appreciate it.

Alan

Adding one more to the mix—PF Fusion Sans Pro Light, a modern font that replicates the look:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-fusion-sans-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322135631/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-fusion-sans-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-fusion-sans-pro/")
